title: Michael Carrick to take HUGE pay cut at Manchester United? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers
text:
Sport Michael Carrick to take HUGE pay cut at Manchester United? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers PLUS: Joe Hart has a new potential suitor AND Watford could be forced to shatter their transfer record in the summer Share Michael Carrick will reportedly have to take a pay cut to stay at Man United (Photo: PA) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Michael Carrick must take a pay cut at Manchester United if he is to extend his stay at the club into a 12th year. 
The 36-year-old joined United in 2006 but his contract is due to expire at the end of this season. 
He was used sparingly by Jose Mourinho at the start of the campaign but has been one of United's key players since he started his first Premier League game of the season on November 6. 
United are unbeaten in the 11 top-flight games Carrick has featured in this campaign, winning seven and drawing four. 
The Sun say Carrick currently rakes in £130,000-a-week but United are only willing to offer him a one-year contract extension if he accepts reduced £70,000-a-week terms. 
Here are the other stories doing the rounds on Friday: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Tony Pulis HATES the January transfer window Share this video Watch Next Transfer news from the Daily Mirror 
Real Madrid are ready to pounce for Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero. The Spanish giants are long-term admirers, and believe the time could be right this summer, with the 28-year-old appearing to have lost his status as an automatic starter for the Blues. Sergio Aguero is wanted by Real Madrid (Photo: Getty) 
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger has admitted he is tracking Monaco starlet Kylian Mbappe - a player he believes “could be another Thierry Henry.” Mbappe has risen to prominence at the French club over the last 18 months, since making his Ligue 1 debut at 16, becoming Henry’s successor as their youngest goalscorer at 17. 
Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic could be open to a sensational move to Napoli, claims Mino Raiola. The super-agent, who was born close to Naples, insists the Swede loves the city and that a move is not out of the question. With 19 goals already this season, Jose Mourinho will be desperate to keep the 35-year-old, but despite an option to extend his deal by a year, Raiola has sparked talk of a move back to Italy for the former Juventus, Inter Milan and AC Milan frontman. A move to Napoli is a possibility for Zlatan Ibrahimovic, the Swede's agent has said (Photo: Clive Mason) 
Swansea manager Paul Clement has revealed he attempted to sign Frank Lampard during the January transfer window. Instead, Lampard called time on his glittering career on Thursday, officially announcing his retirement as a player at the age of 38 having won all there is to win at club level in English football. Other news from the Daily Mirror 
Arsene Wenger wants to feel the love of the Arsenal fans before committing himself to a new contract. There is a new two-year deal on the table, but manager Wenger is acutely aware of the animosity of some Gunners fans - evident after Tuesday's shock home loss to Watford - and is biding his time before deciding whether to stay beyond the expiration of his current pact this summer. Arsene Wenger wants to feel the love from Arsenal's fans before signing a new contract (Photo: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger may have to sit in among Chelsea fans during Saturday’s London derby at Stamford Bridge. Arsenal manager Wenger will be serving the third of a four game touchline ban and cannot sit in the directors’ box as it is on the other side of the ground to the dressing rooms. He is still allowed to give a team talk before the game and at half time so wants easy access and is likely to sit in the middle tier of the East Stand — site of what are described as executive seats occupied by well-heeled supporters. 
Roberto Mancini is waiting in the wings to take over at West Ham if Slaven Bilic fails to turn it around. Mancini was at the London Stadium to see the Hammers lose 4-0 to his old club Manchester City on Wednesday, and is understood to be keen on a return to the Premier League. The onus is now on Bilic to to inspire the 11th-placed Londoners' players to put in improved performances for the remainder of the campaign, with his position to be reviewed in the summer. Former Man City boss Roberto Mancini is ready to take over at the London Stadium (Photo: Getty) 
Rafa Benitez's future as Newcastle manager has been thrown into doubt by the club’s disastrous January transfer window. Boss Benitez is furious the Magpies failed to bring in ANY of his targets, and feels that the terms under which he agreed to take the job on last year have changed. There is no chance of him quitting now, but the former Liverpool and Chelsea boss will hold showdown talks over his future in the summer. Gossip from other newspapers and websites 
West Ham want to sign £15million-rated goalkeeper Joe Hart from Manchester City (The Sun) Joe Hart's Italian Job could be over in the summer if West Ham firm up their interest (Photo: Marco Luzzani) 
Watford will be forced to sign AC Milan loanee M'Baye Niang permanently for £13.5million if he scores 10 goals for the Hornets between now and the end of the season (The Sun)
